TopicTitle: [1.4.2] JDiminishingRTG v1.5.0 : Realistic, configurable radioisotope decay! [29 March 2018]

Articles.Content:
DOWNLOAD

Original for 1.1.3: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/104415-113-jdiminishingrtg-v140-realistic-configurable-radioisotope-decay-8-jul-2016/

 

 

  • An improvement on stock RTG behavior with its eternal power supply.
  • Implements a configurable, robust mechanism for Radioisotope decay and power generation.
  • Parts with ModuleDiminishingRTG will be able to configure their isotope fuel from within the VAB, a single input being reflected across all symmetry companions.
  • Parts should behave consistently between vessel docking/undocking.
  • Decay operates in background (all unfocused vessels).
  • Can be added to any part without interference... probably.
  • Inspired by "Realistic RTGs" plugin by Gribbleschnibit8 http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/96030/
  • ModuleManager redistributed under CC SA license.
@N70 you placed the ModuleManager.3.0.6.dll into your mod's folder ...

Hi @N70

Just putting an idea out there - Did you have any thoughts having something similar (maybe separate to this mod) to model the capacity fade during the lifetime of batteries?

Maybe something that reduces the maximum charge amount for batteries over time and certain conditions? It would give a way for a battery to "wear-out" (albeit slowly) and could factor in things like deep discharge as well as heat damage.

Seperate question - what would you set the efficiency and volume for the MiniRTG that comes with VensStockPack? It has a mass of 0.048t vs the stock RTG 0.08t

Edited June 9, 2018 by wile1411
